definition: lit. to prescribe the right medicine for an illness (idiom); fig. to study a problem to find the right way to solve it/to take appropriate steps
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
disease/illness
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: In doing ideological work, one must suit one's methods to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 做思想工作必須對症下藥。

sentences.english: His financial white paper gets much right.
sentences.chinese: 他的金融白皮書有很多對症下藥之處。

sentences.english: If she had swiftly reached trained medical staff with the right drugs, she would not have died.
sentences.chinese: 如果有訓練有素的醫護人員對症下藥，她不會死去。

sentences.english: And it is possible to find the right medicine even from a quack doctor.
sentences.chinese: 甚至是江湖郎中對症下藥也是可能的。

definition: to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
top priority job/matter of vital importance
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
solution/method to settle an issue
doctor-patient
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
focus/direction/purpose/relevance
to diagnose and treat
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
healing efficacy/healing effect
Chinese and Western medicine/a doctor trained in Chinese and Western medicine
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
feasible/realistic/practical/earnestly/conscientiously
timely handling/a stitch in time
countermeasure for dealing with a situation
fair competition
